'''Iron''' is a [[metal]] found in the [[Overworld]]. It [[World generation|generate]]s naturally as [[iron ore]], which drops raw iron, which can then be smelted into iron ingots. The ingots can then be crafted into blocks, items, [[tool]]s, and [[armor]], making it a versatile material. Iron can often be found at high elevations (such as in mountains) and generates most abundantly at Y=18.

== ''Minecraft'' ==

=== Items and entities ===
* {{ItemLink|Raw Iron}} - drops from iron ore when mined
* {{ItemLink|Iron Ingot}} - created by smelting raw iron
* {{ItemLink|Iron Nugget}} - obtained by smelting iron
* {{ItemLink|Shears}} - used to harvest [[wool]] from [[sheep]]
* {{ItemLink|Bucket}} - used to carry [[water]], [[lava]], [[powder snow]], and various aquatic mobs
* {{ItemLink|Compass}} - directs towards the world spawn or a lodestone
* {{ItemLink|Flint and Steel}} - used to ignite fire
* {{EntityLink|Minecart}} - used to create infrastructure for transportation
* {{EntityLink|Minecart with Chest}} - chest in a minecart
* {{EntityLink|Minecart with Hopper}} - collects items faster than regular hoppers
* {{EntityLink|Minecart with TNT}} - explodes when interacted with
* {{EntityLink|Minecart with Furnace}} - boosts the minecart when interacted with coal or charcoal{{only|java}}
* {{EntityLink|Minecart with Command Block}} - command block in a minecart

=== Blocks ===
* {{BlockLink|Iron Ore}}
* {{BlockLink|Deepslate Iron Ore}} - a variant found in the deepslate layer of the world
* {{BlockLink|Block of Raw Iron}} - used for compact raw iron storage
* {{BlockLink|Block of Iron}} - used for compact iron storage
* {{BlockLink|Iron|link=Iron (element)}} - an element included in ''[[Minecraft Education]]''
* {{BlockLink|Iron Door}} - a door that has to be activated by redstone
* {{BlockLink|Iron Trapdoor}} - a trapdoor that has to be activated by redstone
* {{BlockLink|Heavy Weighted Pressure Plate}} - emits a redstone signal when stepped on
* {{BlockLink|Anvil}} - used to rename, repair, and enchant items
** {{BlockLink|Chipped Anvil}} - the chipped variant of the anvil
** {{BlockLink|Damaged Anvil}} - the damaged variant of the anvil
* {{BlockLink|Hopper}} - collects and sends items through either itself or other storage containers
* {{BlockLink|Piston}} - used to push and move blocks
* {{BlockLink|Crafter}} - crafts items and blocks automatically via [[redstone]]
* {{Blocklink|Lantern}} - a decorative block used to light up
** {{BlockLink|Soul Lantern}} - a decorative block used to light up
* {{BlockLink|Lodestone}} - used to alter compasses to point toward it
* {{BlockLink|Smithing Table}} - used to [[trim]] and upgrade tools and armor
* {{BlockLink|Blast Furnace}} - smelts ores and metal items and blocks faster than a regular [[furnace]]
* {{BlockLink|Stonecutter}} - used to craft stone and copper blocks more efficiently than the [[crafting Table]] or [[crafter]]
* {{BlockLink|Cauldron}} - used to hold [[water]], [[lava]], and [[powder snow]]
* {{BlockLink|Iron Bars}} - similar to glass panes but is more blast-resistant
* {{BlockLink|Iron Chain}} - a decorative building block
* {{BlockLink|Tripwire Hook}} - used to craft tripwire circuits that send a redstone signal when interacted with
* {{BlockLink|Rail}} - used to facilitate transportation through minecarts
* {{BlockLink|Detector Rail}} - sends a redstone signal when detecting a Minecart above it
* {{BlockLink|Activator Rail}} - ejects [[player]]s and [[mob]]s from regular minecarts, lock and unlock [[minecarts with hoppers]], and ignite [[minecarts with TNT]]
